oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Greetings from the City of Memphis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Scenes of Memphis: Cossit Library; Lily Pond, Overton Park; Country Club; Landing at Riverside Park; Handling Cotton; Forest [i.e. Forrest] Monument; Tennessee Trust Building. Two-cent red George Washington postage stamp.
Memphis was a key port on the Mississippi River with a thriving cotton exchange.
Miss Lily Holland, Central Falls, Rhode Island
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Buildings; Libraries; Monuments; Parks; Cotton; Postage stamps
